subject: Design
title: The Assembly Line: Designing Speed
description: Learn The Assembly Line: Designing Speed in one minute.

hook.text: In 1913, it took 12 hours to build a Model T. Henry Ford thought that was absurd.

buildup.text: Ford didn't invent the car. He redesigned the process â€” a moving line where the car came to the worker.

discovery.text: By breaking assembly into 84 discrete steps, any worker could learn their task in minutes.

twist.text: Production time dropped to 93 minutes. The car's price fell from $850 to $260.

climax.text: Ford's design wasn't a product â€” it was a process that made products accessible to millions.

punchline.text: Sometimes the most important design is the process.
